phrase_cn: 叫你的仆人大**放**胆量讲你的道
phrase_en: To continue to speak your word with all **boldness**
sentence_context: And now, Lord, look upon their threats and grant to your servants to continue to speak your word with all boldness,
nuance_note: Boldness (Parrhesia) 指公开发言的坦率和自由，Brave 只是心理状态。

phrase_cn: 我们生活、**动作**...都在乎他
phrase_en: In him we live and **move** and **have our being**
sentence_context: for 'In him we live and move and have our being'; as even some of your own poets have said, 'For we are indeed his offspring.'
nuance_note: Have our being 是极具哲学深度和神学张力的表达，Exist 太干瘪。

phrase_cn: 但圣灵降临在你们身上，你们就必得着能力，并要在耶路撒冷、犹太全地和撒马利亚，直到地极，作我的见证。
phrase_en: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth.
sentence_context: And he said to them, “It is not for you to know times or seasons that the Father has fixed by his own authority. But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth.”
nuance_note: 'Witnesses' (μάρτυρες) implies active testimony and proclamation of truth, not merely being a spectator or 'seeing' events.

phrase_cn: 他们就都被圣灵充满，按着圣灵所赐的口才说起别国的话来。
phrase_en: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues as the Spirit gave them utterance.
sentence_context: And suddenly there came from heaven a sound like a mighty rushing wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting. And divided tongues as of fire appeared to them and rested on each one of them. And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues as the Spirit gave them utterance.
nuance_note: 'Filled' (ἐπλήσθησαν) emphasizes a divine empowerment and indwelling, not merely a physical container being full, and refers to the people who form the Church, not a physical 'building'.

phrase_cn: 彼得对他们说：“你们各人要悔改，奉耶稣基督的名受洗，叫你们的罪得赦，就必领受所赐的圣灵。
phrase_en: And Peter said to them, 'Repent and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.'
sentence_context: Now when they heard this they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, “Brothers, what shall we do?” And Peter said to them, “Repent and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.”
nuance_note: 'Repent' (μετανοήσατε) signifies a change of mind and direction in one's life, a turning from sin to God, which is a change in 'The Way' of living, not just a physical turn on a 'road'.

phrase_cn: 所以你们当悔改归正，使你们的罪得以涂抹，
phrase_en: Repent therefore, and turn back, that your sins may be blotted out,
sentence_context: Repent therefore, and turn back, that your sins may be blotted out, that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord,
nuance_note: 'Turn back' (ἐπιστρέψατε) means to convert or return to God, indicating a change of 'The Way' of life, not merely a physical 'road' direction.

phrase_cn: 他们就每日在殿里、在家里不住地教训人，传讲耶稣是基督。
phrase_en: And every day, in the temple and from house to house, they did not cease teaching and preaching Jesus as the Christ.
sentence_context: And every day, in the temple and from house to house, they did not cease teaching and preaching Jesus as the Christ.
nuance_note: 'Preaching' (εὐαγγελιζόμενοι) here refers to the active proclamation of the good news, showing that the early 'Church' was active both in public spaces ('temple') and private homes, not confined to a single 'building'.

phrase_cn: 神的道兴旺起来；在耶路撒冷门徒数目加增的甚多，也有许多祭司信从了这道。
phrase_en: And the word of God continued to increase, and the number of the disciples multiplied greatly in Jerusalem, and a great many of the priests became obedient to the faith.
sentence_context: And the word of God continued to increase, and the number of the disciples multiplied greatly in Jerusalem, and a great many of the priests became obedient to the faith.
nuance_note: 'The word of God' (τὸν λόγον τοῦ θεοῦ) growing refers to the spread of the Gospel and the Christian 'Way' of life, not a literal 'road' or a physical thing that grows.

phrase_cn: 我也要指示他，为我的名必须受许多的苦难。
phrase_en: For I will show him how much he must suffer for the sake of my name.
sentence_context: But the Lord said to him, “Go, for he is a chosen instrument of mine to carry my name before the Gentiles and kings and the children of Israel. For I will show him how much he must suffer for the sake of my name.”
nuance_note: 'Suffer' (παθεῖν) here denotes active endurance and participation in Christ's mission, which serves as a powerful 'witness', not merely a passive 'looker' at hardship.

phrase_cn: 因为主曾这样吩咐我们说：‘我已经立你作外邦人的光，叫你施行救恩，直到地极。’
phrase_en: For so the Lord has commanded us, saying, 'I have made you a light for the Gentiles, that you may bring salvation to the ends of the earth.'
sentence_context: For so the Lord has commanded us, saying, ‘I have made you a light for the Gentiles, that you may bring salvation to the ends of the earth.’
nuance_note: 'Light for the Gentiles' (φῶς ἐθνῶν) means to actively reveal God's truth and salvation, serving as a 'witness', not just being something for others to 'see' passively.

phrase_cn: 坚固门徒的心，劝他们恒守所信的道；又说：“我们进入神的国，必须经历许多艰难。”
phrase_en: strengthening the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to continue in the faith, and saying that through many tribulations we must enter the kingdom of God.
sentence_context: When they had preached the gospel to that city and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra and to Iconium and to Antioch, strengthening the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to continue in the faith, and saying that through many tribulations we must enter the kingdom of God.
nuance_note: 'Tribulations' (θλίψεων) implies pressure, distress, and suffering that are part of the Christian 'Way' or 'method' of discipleship, not merely difficulties encountered on a physical 'road'.

phrase_cn: 我却不以性命为念，也不看为宝贵，只要行完我的路程，成就我从主耶稣所领受的职事，证明神恩惠的福音。
phrase_en: But I do not account my life of any value nor as precious to myself, if only I may finish my course and the ministry that I received from the Lord Jesus, to testify to the gospel of the grace of God.
sentence_context: But I do not account my life of any value nor as precious to myself, if only I may finish my course and the ministry that I received from the Lord Jesus, to testify to the gospel of the grace of God.
nuance_note: 'Testify' (διαμαρτύρασθαι) implies a solemn and thorough declaration of truth, an active 'witness', not just a passive 'looker' or observer of events.

phrase_cn: 因为约翰是用水施洗，但不多几日，你们要受圣灵的洗。
phrase_en: for John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.
sentence_context: And while staying with them he ordered them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the promise of the Father, which, he said, “you heard from me; for John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”
nuance_note: The contrast between John's water baptism and the Spirit baptism signifies a new covenant reality, marking the beginning of the Spirit's indwelling and empowerment.

phrase_cn: 他们祷告完了，聚会的地方震动，他们就都被圣灵充满，放胆讲论神的道。
phrase_en: And when they had prayed, the place in which they were gathered together was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and continued to speak the word of God with boldness.
sentence_context: And when they had prayed, the place in which they were gathered together was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and continued to speak the word of God with boldness.
nuance_note: Being 'filled with the Holy Spirit' (πλησθῆναι πνεύματος ἁγίου) is a dynamic experience of empowerment for bold proclamation, distinct from initial conversion.

phrase_cn: 我们为这些事作见证，神赐给顺从之人的圣灵也为这些事作见证。
phrase_en: And we are witnesses to these things, and so is the Holy Spirit whom God has given to those who obey him.”
sentence_context: But Peter and the apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men. The God of our fathers raised Jesus, whom you murdered by hanging him on a tree. God exalted him at his right hand as Leader and Savior, to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins. And we are witnesses to these things, and so is the Holy Spirit whom God has given to those who obey him.”
nuance_note: A 'witness' (μάρτυς) in Acts is not merely an observer but one who testifies to what they have seen and heard, often facing opposition for their testimony.

phrase_cn: 及至他们信了腓利所传神国的福音和耶稣基督的名，连男带女就受了洗。
phrase_en: But when they believed Philip as he preached good news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
sentence_context: But when they believed Philip as he preached good news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
nuance_note: Philip 'preached good news' (εὐηγγελίζετο) about the Kingdom, highlighting the active, verbal nature of early Christian mission and evangelism.

phrase_cn: 主的手与他们同在，信而归主的人非常多。
phrase_en: And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number who believed turned to the Lord.
sentence_context: Now those who were scattered because of the persecution that arose over Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except Jews. But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who on coming to Antioch spoke to the Hellenists also, preaching the Lord Jesus. And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number who believed turned to the Lord.
nuance_note: 'Turned to the Lord' (ἐπέστρεψεν ἐπὶ τὸν Κύριον) signifies conversion—a decisive change of allegiance and direction in life, embracing Christ.

phrase_cn: 找到了，就带他到安提阿去。他们足有一年工夫和教会一同聚集，教训了许多人。门徒称为基督徒是从安提阿起首。
phrase_en: And when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. For a whole year they met with the church and taught a great many people. And in Antioch the disciples were first called Christians.
sentence_context: So Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul, and when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. For a whole year they met with the church and taught a great many people. And in Antioch the disciples were first called Christians.
nuance_note: The act of 'teaching' (διδάσκειν) within the early church in Antioch was a crucial form of proclaiming the gospel and building up believers in faith.

phrase_cn: 保罗既看见这异象，我们随即想要往马其顿去，以为神召我们传福音给那里的人听。
phrase_en: And when Paul had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go on into Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them.
sentence_context: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night: a man of Macedonia was standing there, urging him and saying, “Come over to Macedonia and help us.” And when Paul had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go on into Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them.
nuance_note: The 'call to preach' (εὐαγγελίσασθαι) indicates a divine commission to share the gospel, driven by the Holy Spirit's guidance, often through visions.

phrase_cn: 保罗说：“你们为什么又哭又叫，使我心碎呢？我为主耶稣的名，不但被人捆绑，就是死在耶路撒冷也是愿意的。”
phrase_en: Then Paul answered, “What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be imprisoned but even to die in Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”
sentence_context: Then Paul answered, “What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be imprisoned but even to die in Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”
nuance_note: Paul's readiness to 'suffer' (πάσχειν) and die for Christ exemplifies the cost of discipleship and mission, often involving severe persecution.

phrase_cn: 但有一件事我向你承认，就是他们所称为“异端”的道，我正按着这道事奉我祖宗的神，又信奉律法和先知书上一切所记载的。
phrase_en: But this I confess to you, that according to the Way, which they call a sect, I worship the God of our fathers, believing everything laid down by the Law and written in the Prophets,
sentence_context: But this I confess to you, that according to the Way, which they call a sect, I worship the God of our fathers, believing everything laid down by the Law and written in the Prophets,
nuance_note: 'The Way' (ἡ ὁδός) was an early designation for Christianity, which Paul defends by proclaiming his faith in the God of his fathers, showing it's not a new sect but the fulfillment of prophecy.

phrase_cn: 要开他们的眼睛，使他们从黑暗中归向光明，从撒但权下归向神；又因信我，得蒙赦罪，和一切成圣的人同得基业。’
phrase_en: to open their eyes, so that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins and a place among those who are sanctified by faith in me.’
sentence_context: to open their eyes, so that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins and a place among those who are sanctified by faith in me.’
nuance_note: This verse describes the transformative mission of opening eyes and 'turning' (ἐπιστρέψαι) people from darkness to light, a core aspect of evangelism and conversion.

phrase_cn: 我们听见他们用我们的乡谈，讲说神的大作为。
phrase_en: we hear them telling in our own tongues the mighty works of God.
sentence_context: both Jews and proselytes, Cretans and Arabians—we hear them telling in our own tongues the mighty works of God.
trap: Telling could be misinterpreted as casual 'speaking' rather than declaring God's works.
nuance_note: The Greek 'διηγουμένων' (diēgoumenōn) implies narrating or declaring in detail, emphasizing the substance and significance of God's 'mighty works' (μεγαλεῖα).

phrase_cn: 那时，彼得被圣灵充满，对他们说：
phrase_en: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them,
sentence_context: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers of the people and elders,
nuance_note: To be 'filled' (πλησθεὶς) with the Holy Spirit signifies being empowered and controlled by the Spirit for specific divine purposes, enabling bold proclamation and action.

phrase_cn: 凡住吕大和沙仑的人都看见了他，就都归向主。
phrase_en: And all the residents of Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.
sentence_context: And all the residents of Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.
trap: Turn could be interpreted as a physical '转身' (physical turning) rather than spiritual conversion.
nuance_note: The verb 'ἐπέστρεψαν' (epestrepsan) denotes a turning or returning to the Lord, signifying repentance and conversion from former ways to Christ.

phrase_cn: 全教会和听见这事的人都甚惧怕。
phrase_en: And great fear came upon the whole church and upon all who heard of these things.
sentence_context: And great fear came upon the whole church and upon all who heard of these things.
trap: Church could be misconstrued as a physical 'Building' (建筑物) or 'Temple' (殿堂).
nuance_note: The Greek 'ἐκκλησία' (ekklēsia) refers to the assembly or gathering of believers, the called-out community, not a physical edifice.

phrase_cn: 众先知也为他作见证说：凡信他的人，必因他的名得蒙赦罪。
phrase_en: To him all the prophets bear witness that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name.
sentence_context: To him all the prophets bear witness that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name.”
trap: Witness could be misinterpreted as merely 'See' (看) or a 'Looker' (旁观者).
nuance_note: To 'bear witness' (μαρτυροῦσιν) means to testify or give evidence, specifically to the truth concerning Jesus Christ and his saving work.

phrase_cn: 他们离开公会，心里欢喜，因被算是配为这名受辱。
phrase_en: Then they left the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for the name.
sentence_context: Then they left the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for the name.
trap: Suffer could be limited to physical pain ('疼痛') rather than enduring hardship or persecution for a cause.
nuance_note: 'Suffer dishonor' (ἀτιμασθῆναι) implies enduring disgrace or mistreatment as a form of persecution directly linked to their allegiance to Jesus' 'name'.

phrase_cn: 于是吩咐车停住，腓利和太监二人同下水里去，腓利就给他施洗。
phrase_en: And he commanded the chariot to stop, and they both went down into the water, Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.
sentence_context: And he commanded the chariot to stop, and they both went down into the water, Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.
trap: Baptize could be misconstrued as a general 'washing' (洗) rather than a specific religious rite.
nuance_note: The verb 'ἐβάπτισεν' (ebaptisen) refers to the act of Christian baptism, signifying identification with Christ and inclusion into the community of faith through immersion.

phrase_cn: 那时，为这道起的扰乱不小。
phrase_en: About that time there arose no little disturbance concerning the Way.
sentence_context: About that time there arose no little disturbance concerning the Way.
trap: The Way could be misinterpreted as a physical 'Road' (道路) or a 'Method' (方法).
nuance_note: 'The Way' (τῆς ὁδοῦ) was an early and significant self-designation for Christianity, referring to the distinct lifestyle, teachings, and spiritual path of Jesus' followers.
